title: How to Remove Gluten from Your Diet

steps.headline: Remove wheat from your kitchen: start with bread, pasta and pizzas as these items contain a lot of wheat, which is really bad for people on a gluten free diet.
Remove items containing barley and other cereals like oats and barley as they also contain gluten.
steps.description: This is due to contamination: they are produced in factories using wheat.Note: Maize is gluten-free.

steps.headline: Regarding alcohol, you need to stop drinking beer (you can now find gluten-free beer though) and whiskey.
Start reading the labels on every item you are going to buy.
steps.description: Avoid the ingredients listed above, but be careful of starch (can be made of wheat) and dextrose.

steps.headline: Nearly all supermarkets sell gluten-free food: bread, pizzas, biscuits, pastas...
steps.description: It'll make your life a lot easier!

steps.headline: Be careful when you go out as you don't know what ingredients are used in their recipes.
steps.description: You'll have to ask the chef for what you can/can't have. Be careful of take outs and Chinese restaurants as they use soy sauce a lot (soy sauce does contain gluten). French fries may also be coated with a wheat mixture.

steps.headline: Start cooking fresh food!
steps.description: That's the best way to stay on a gluten free diet. You know what you put in your own dishes. And you will eat so well that you'll be glad you can no longer eat gluten.

text: Remove wheat from your kitchen: start with bread, pasta and pizzas as these items contain a lot of wheat, which is really bad for people on a gluten free diet.  Remove items containing barley and other cereals like oats and barley as they also contain gluten. This is due to contamination: they are produced in factories using wheat.Note: Maize is gluten-free. Regarding alcohol, you need to stop drinking beer (you can now find gluten-free beer though) and whiskey. The other drinks are OK. Start reading the labels on every item you are going to buy. Avoid the ingredients listed above, but be careful of starch (can be made of wheat) and dextrose. Nearly all supermarkets sell gluten-free food: bread, pizzas, biscuits, pastas... It'll make your life a lot easier! Be careful when you go out as you don't know what ingredients are used in their recipes. You'll have to ask the chef for what you can/can't have. Be careful of take outs and Chinese restaurants as they use soy sauce a lot (soy sauce does contain gluten). French fries may also be coated with a wheat mixture. Start cooking fresh food! That's the best way to stay on a gluten free diet. You know what you put in your own dishes. And you will eat so well that you'll be glad you can no longer eat gluten.
